alert.note: Alert for Socorro (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 30 at 5:18PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM MDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Arroyo and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central New Mexico, including the following county, Socorro. * WHEN...Until 800 PM MDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 512 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms moving west to southwest across the Interstate 25 corridor from Lemitar to Socorro. This will cause arroyo and small stream flooding. Up to 1 inch of rain has fallen over parts of the area. - Additional rainfall amounts between 0.50 and 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Socorro, Escondida, Lemitar, Chamizal, Luis Lopez, Water Canyon, Torreon Springs Road, and County Road 85. - This includes the following highways... Highway 60 between Mile Markers 116 and 138. Interstate 25 between Mile Markers 144 and 161. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
